headline.main: Smoking Hastens Facial Wrinkling, Study Finds

docs.lead_paragraph: A NEW study has confirmed that people who smoke are more susceptible to facial wrinkles than nonsmokers. The study, by Dr. Donald P. Kadunce, a dermatologist, and five colleagues at the University of Utah Health Sciences Center, involved 109 smokers and 23 people who had never smoked, all between the ages of 35 and 59.
